title: Levi's Men's Washed Cotton Hooded Military Jacket
description: This jacket in rich neutral colors will you keep as warm as you need to be with its removable hood and lining.

reviews.name: Justin
reviews.review:
I feel like I got very lucky with my purchase here. I pulled the trigger on the tall and am so glad that I did because it's just the right length in the arms and the torso. For reference, I'm 6'3 and around 210lbs and I got the large tall. I would opt for XL a lot of the time but with reviews saying this ran big I decided to stick with the large.

This is made of really sturdy materials. Not as sturdy as something like a Carhartt for example, which in my opinion is almost too tough (and quite a bit more expensive), but it feels like this is built to last a good while. The detachable hoodie part is a really cool touch. The wrist cuffs have two buttons for a looser or tighter fit. The inside of the torso is sherpa while the inside of the arms is a nice quilted material. The front pockets for your hands are on the sides, although the pictures make it seem like they would go in under a flap. I got the brown version (lighter one) and it's exactly as pictured. Overall I'm happy with this coat overall and look forward to perhaps buying other colors.

reviews.name: Barredbard
reviews.reviewTitle: A Great Fit for an Understated Look
reviews.review:
I had always wanted a winter coat that didn't quite look like one, or have the bulk and heft of one. The somewhat pseudo-military or even quasi-cowboy look has always appealed to me. I am thrilled with this coat. I usually wear a large, but with winter coats I tend to get a size up, to accommodate any garments underneath. It was the right call. The look is crisp and understated, which is what I was going for. With the hood, it's a blend of the trendy, with the classic.

As I wore it for the first time, I thought the only thing missing is the ability to remove the hood at my option. I checked, and low and behold, the hood can be unzipped and removed. I am not sure why this important feature was not mentioned. I almost did not buy it because I was debating that white hood. The fact that it can be removed is excellent.

Great coat.

reviews.name: Malckiah
reviews.review: I bought an XXL based on what everyone was saying. I ended up sending back for XL which I never do... but when I got the wrong size I could see that this jacket was WELL worth the money. Definitely a good quality jacket that will keep you warm. I would definitely reccomend and it was worth the trouble to send it back for the right size. I am 5"10... 190lbs... XL is perfect for me.

reviews.name: Aqueeta Parker
reviews.review: I have been looking for a jacket for my boyfriend for some time and finally stumbled on this on. It is a perfect fit, he is 5‚Äô11 200 lbs, just below is waist. We got it in a size large, it is the perfect jacker for the rainy winter season because it works well at a rain jacket as well as a layered winter coat.

reviews.name: Louis arc
reviews.reviewTitle: Fits comfortably but durability is questionable
reviews.review: After less than a year with this jacket, a portion of the back has a rip about 7 inches long and has exposed the cotton underneath. I would like to arrange for a replacement if possible because it is a nice jacket but can't continue wearing it as is.

reviews.name: robert dolan
reviews.reviewTitle: I like how it looks and feels
reviews.review: Step above a Hoodie jacket can wear with other jackets under the coat or with a coat over it very warm I have 2 of them now.

reviews.name: Janine W
reviews.review: Gift for my husband and he absolutely loves it!! Commented numerous times how much he loves the fit, the look and the style. Definitely two thumbs up üëç üëç purchase!!

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.reviewTitle: Way way to short in the shoulder.
reviews.review: I wear XL so I order XXL so it would fix with sweat shirt and it was so tight in the upper arms and shoulders I couldn't raise my arm and the shoulder seam was on top of my shoulders. I returning the XXL and ordering a XXXL hopeful the arm will not be to long.

reviews.name: rjg.1969
reviews.review: Good fit. Quality jacket. Quality brand.

reviews.name: P Williamson
reviews.review: Excellent fit

reviews.name: Glen
reviews.review:
I love the look of this jacket, but I must say the quality has left me disappointed. The fit is not overly generous for the size I bought, but it's OK. The main issues I have had are that the zipper pull broke on day one - not a big problem, I was able to rig a replacement, and yesterday (just after the return period closed), a seam on the right sleeve at the back of the shoulder opened up about 4 inches. I had to take the jacket to a tailor to repair it. I have only worn the jacket a few times so far, so there's no way it should be coming apart already. Really not impressed.

Update 22-2-22 - today the seam on other sleeve came apart as I was simply reaching up to take off my hat. This jacket is SUCH poor quality - I STRONGLY ADVISE AGAISNT BUYING ONE. I will be contacting the seller to see if they will refund, even though the date has passed.

reviews.name: Mau
reviews.review: Me encantan los materiales, el forro, el te√±ido y la talla. Creo que es la primera prensa que siento me convenci√≥ en todo aspecto

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: Way too short on me, bought a large and the only sizing charts are for chest size but nothing about length. I am 6'4" and unfortunately only realized it didn't fit after I removed the tags. Every shirt I own sticks out the bottom of the jacket. I like the quality of it though but it would be nice if I knew what size would actually fit me.

title: Wrangler Authentics Men's Long Sleeve Quilted Lined Flannel Shirt Jacket with Hood
description: Perfect for the cold winter days, the Wrangler authentic big and tall long sleeve quilted lined flannel shirt jacket with hood features quilted body interior, 2 side pockets and a brushed flannel exterior. The jacket offers a cotton blend hood offering more warmth and comfort, making this jacket a go to item for any man this winter.

reviews.name: Kirsten
reviews.review: Got this as a gift for my boyfriend and it fits perfect and is good quality! Although, I didn't realize or pay attention to if this was a zip up jacket or button up but this jacket is a button up one. Super light weight and he wears it all the time and likes it.

reviews.name: Sonia
reviews.review: This jacket is really light, very similar to a windbreaker. Love the style, it‚Äôs a button up jacket with a hoodie. Will definitely use when it‚Äôs a little cool, more of a 70 degree jacket, not a 60 degree weather jacket.

reviews.name: Kimberly Chamblin
reviews.reviewTitle: Great flannel not too hot just right
reviews.review: What a great shirt it's very well made soft and comfortable. Everything then some you would expect out of a great quality shirt. Very happy with this purchase

reviews.name: Litlmarn74
reviews.reviewTitle: Keeps you warm my son loves it.
reviews.review: Flannels seem to be back in and this was a hit with my almost 20 yr old. Nice quality and warm when you don‚Äôt want a heavy coat.

reviews.name: Audrey Olson
reviews.review: My son loved the fit, feel and style of this flannel with a hood. I really liked the color of it. He has been wearing it daily to and forth to the gym. Good price.

reviews.name: Tiffany
reviews.review: My husband absolutely loves this wrangler jacket. It is lightweight but it keeps him warm and it‚Äôs very comfortable. The hood is a plus and it‚Äôs true to size.

reviews.name: Sandra
reviews.review: Bought as a Christmas present for my son. He loved the colors the fit. He said that it wasn‚Äôt to light or to heavy.

reviews.name: TEBY
reviews.reviewTitle: A little different type of material
reviews.review: The material is different. It feels like more of a poly blend than 100% cotton. I guess it's for less shrinkage after drying.

reviews.name: Ganie
reviews.review: Medium size is perfect for me (5'-8", 165lbs). The outer material is great and feels really good. The inside lining is warm enough for quick errands in this winter weather. Really nice color. Does not bleed during washing. 4-star rating is due to getting a bit deformed after the first wash. I think the outside material shrinked a little bit but the inside lining remained the same. Ironing could probably fix it but I am still not quite happy about it. But overall quality and fit is great.

reviews.name: christopher gallagher
reviews.review: very little padding in the quilting

reviews.name: hdamoca
reviews.reviewTitle: Nice but huge. I mean HUGE.
reviews.review: I bought this for my husband for Christmas. He's not a big guy but I figured it's , often clothes are way smaller than Canadian or US made clothes, so I went up 2 sizes. Wish I hadn't as the 2X is about 3 sizes too big. I sent the shirt back and reordered an Xlarge, it's still humungous, arms hanging past his fingertips. I worried that going down to a large would be too small after washing, so I kept the bigger size and hope it shrinks some. So, buy the size you'd buy in stores, don't size up or you'll be returning one too.

reviews.name: Maya B.
reviews.review: My husband requested one of these for his ritualistic campfire every Saturday night to keep warm during the Canadian Autumn days. He received it and was well pleased. It was the right fit, perfect fit even, and was very comfortable. Mind you, my husband weighs about 210 lbs and is about 5'10". It's only been one day, so I'll make sure to change my review if ever we find snags or issues with this jacket.

reviews.name: Steve Bogdon
reviews.review:
I like it. That said I read the reviews and there were lots of people mentioning this should have a zipper rather than the buttons. I ordered it thinking the buttons would be fine, I was wrong.

I still like this coat and wear it often but with the style, fit, and fabric weight.....a zipper would have been a nice feature.

I would still order it again with the buttons but would order faster with a zipper.

title: Essentials Men's Lightweight Water-Resistant Packable Hooded Puffer Jacket
description: Essentials is focused on creating affordable, high-quality, and long-lasting everyday clothing you can rely on. Our line of men‚Äôs must-haves includes polo shirts, chino pants, classic-fit shorts, casual button-downs, and crew-neck tees. Our consistent sizing takes the guesswork out of shopping, and each piece is put to the test to maintain the highest standards in quality and comfort.

reviews.name: joel oleta
reviews.reviewTitle: felt like it wasnt going to do the job, i was wrong its great
reviews.review:
Well i bought this so i can have an affordable puffer jacket i can abuse and not feel bad about. used it for everything and anything that involved being cold outside.
Not wanting to risk expensive jacket incase i ruin it or hate it i purchased this one but so far it has withstood the abuse. i am pleased with the purchase and i recommend it if your in the market for this item and price is an issue . i have used it for concerts ,camping ,late night shopping trips ,taking out the trash at 4 am also just for the random day hikes .
things i like it packs really small and is very light it also comes with its own drawstring bag that seams to match the color you purchased , i think anyhow because i have purchased 4 different colors (Christmas presents for family members ) and all come this way.
Also this thing does very well in windy conditions it seams to have a very thin feel for a puffer jacket but the small amount of insulations paired with the inner and outer shell of jacket material reminds me of safety blankets ability to reflect body heat back to you this feature for staying warm is doing great for lack of "poof".
i took this to a outdoor concert in LA (besame mucho) and it was very cold and windy because of concert rules only small see through bags were allowed so i brought this jacket in its drawstring bag and took a very small amount of space and was perfect for the situation kept me warm through the whole night night. had very large outside pockets with zipper closures and very deep inside pocket behind the outside zip up ones, they seam to share the space keep this in mind when placing bulky items one side will use space from the other even thought they are separate a pocket . the hoody does not have draw strings but i dont feel needs them i think we have gotten use to everything needing drawstrings, it is a bit spacious inside the hood i guess if you have a beanie or a baseball style cap it should fit fine and extends just before the bill of cap. i just hated that they tried to ship it in no box just a clear see through bag the first time had to return arrived damaged.
In new condition its durability is uncertain until this point it has held up (2months), not sure yet the feel is not the toughest it has a thin feel but notably i have not torn it and it has at least been through the wash once keep in mind i airdried all this said it looks brand new and is in great shape , i would whole heartedly recommend this jacket just look for the deals also get the vest for an added layer of warmth

reviews.name: Bill O.
reviews.reviewTitle: Runs a little big but does a good job of being a lightweight jacket
reviews.review:
The main purpose of a lightweight jacket is to keep you warm when it's cool outside but not super cold. For me that means I purchased this jacket for temps between 35 and 60. I wouldn't want to rely on it any colder than that. For that purpose, it does extremely well. I don't feel too hot wearing it in the upper 50s, and as long as I don't spend hours outside when it's in the 30s, it keeps me warm.

My only knock is that the sizing feels like it is from 20 years ago when everything was a bit more loose fitting. That's good if you want to layer up, but the styling is not the current trend of slim/ form fitting. Since I'm an older guy now, that's not as important to me, but it may be for others.

reviews.name: Linda-Lu
reviews.review:
I bought a man‚Äôs jacket for the extra length and larger pockets. I know the sleeves are too long. But idm. I‚Äôll just roll them up. A size down would‚Äôve been better, but there‚Äôs nothing wrong with a little extra space for layering. (I‚Äôm not doing any fashion shows). My comfort is my priority.

The jacket feels good on. It‚Äôs light weight.
It stores nicely into the sack provided and comes out wrinkle-free. It allows for a sufficient/confortable heat and is rain resistant (in a light rain). I tested it out today.

Overall, I am VERY VERY happy with this jacket. I‚Äôm glad I bought it.

I only wish I had another one to alternate between colors.

reviews.name: Breck
reviews.review: Is this the best puffer jacket you can get? Probably not. Is it a fantastic value, high-quality puffer jacket for a fraction of the price of others? You betcha. Very pleased with this jacket. I did order a size up and I'm glad I did. I typically wear an XL, but I ordered an XXL so I can wear it over thicker hoodies and sweaters and I'm glad I did. I don't think the XL would be as comfortable over bulky layers. The XXL is almost too big though, I wish there was like a 1.5 or something. But I'm still very happy with it. It's a higher quality jacket than I was anticipating. It's very lightweight and packs up super small when you need it to. If you're looking for a quality jacket for chilly weather, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: Jerry L.
reviews.review: If you need or want a good puff jacket that you can easily pack into your hiking pack and a just in case you need it jacket this is it. I have a Columbia one as well that is much warmer to be honest but I got this more for cool fall days, it is truly worth the price. When it gets wet I do not feel like it is making me wet so it has good weather resistance. If you are a guy who is not small order a size up than you normally would get, it will fit you much better.

reviews.name: A-Aron
reviews.reviewTitle: Great Versatile Jacket on Grand Canyon Backpacking Trip
reviews.review: Took a risk on this budget jacket as a lightweight warm layer option during a three day Grand Canyon November backpacking trip. Setting out, I wore frog toggs on top of this jacket as a water resistant layer as we descended the south rim in a ‚Äúwinter mix‚Äù as one ranger referred to it, a sideways barrage of freezing rain and hail. We were moving at a good pace with 40lb packs, but this jacket kept me at a perfect temperature for all days of the hike. At night, I wore it to bed in a 20-degree sleeping bag and it kept me toasty as overnight temps were near freezing. I thought it might be a single use type of product, but I continue to wear it as a primary option out and about when I want to stay warm. I‚Äôll likely take it on another trip and will happily do so. I wouldn‚Äôt trust it in a downpour, but it can take a short, light sprinkle without issue. Zipper is higher quality than expected, hood is prefect, comes with a small stash bag.

reviews.name: Sush.Diss
reviews.review:
This is a very lightweight yet effective jacket. Keeps you warm. It has two large pockets closed with zips (no chest pocket or inner pockets). The hood does not have a zip code to tighten around the face. The main zip slider is strangely on the left. It slides easily.
But this is a very comfortable jacket. Well worth the price. I ordered one size larger as my arms are longer than what it should be. So it fits slightly loose on the chest.
Overall I like the jacket. Would recommend to others.

reviews.name: Matt Morris
reviews.review: Nice jacket. Smooth, soft, warm, comfy. I'm a 41" chest and it fits nicely around my shoulders chest and arms, but it's pretty baggy around the stomach. As there's no elastic at the bottom it's pretty loose. Will likely see if a tailor can put some elastic in it or something. Probably better off waiting to see if Trespass have anything in the Christmas sales to be honest.

reviews.name: Kiran
reviews.review:
100% Good value for money
Quality is better than what I paid.
Only one suggestion or downside, this is not adjustable, they could easily make this adjustable but still deserves 5 star
Reduced 5 to 4 stares for the following reasons:
1) Zipper is apposite side (this is not related to cost )
2) Tested on moderate chilli wind and it doesn't stand. (I understand it is a lightweight but I expect it holds for moderate cold weather )

reviews.name: Jerry C.B.
reviews.review: Accurate sizing.Comfortable fit;ideal for spring or autumn when weather is more unpredictable.Not easy to fit into bag provided but otherwise as good as expected.Slightly overpriced but, overall, no complaints.

reviews.name: ardbigyin
reviews.reviewTitle: dont like zip on womens side
reviews.review: bought from  warehouse i bought xl iam roughly 46/48 maybe should have bought large as loose on me would not pay full price that amazon are asking for
